byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.

abstract: Islamic State is encouraging followers to commit terrorist attacks during Ramadan, perverting and exploiting Islamic belief that noble acts done during Muslim holy month earn greater rewards.
lead_paragraph: Muslims widely consider Ramadan to be, in part, a time of extra reward for noble acts, but jihadists have used it to inspire more killing.

headline.main: ISIS Uses Ramadan as Calling for New Terrorist Attacks
headline.print_headline: Jihadists Twist Themes of Ramadan to Exploit Belief in Holy Rewards

snippet: Muslims widely consider Ramadan to be, in part, a time of extra reward for noble acts, but jihadists have used it to inspire more killing....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
